place.name: REYMERSTON
place.gazetteerText: REYMERSTON, a parish, with a village, in Mitford district, Norfolk; 1½ mile S W of Thuxton r. station, and 5¼ S S E of East Dereham. Post-town, Hingham, under Attleborough. Acres, 1, 599. Real property, £3,099. Pop., 321. Houses, 69. The property is divided among a few. Old Manor Hall belongs to B. Gurdon, Esq.; and New Hall is the seat of G. L. Press, Esq. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Norwich. Value, £338.* Patron, B. Gurdon, Esq. The church is good. Charities, £42. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
